flag.name: aborted_intent_cleanup_max_batch_size
flag.meaning: Number of transactions to collect for possible cleanup.

flag.name: aborted_intent_cleanup_ms
flag.meaning: Duration in ms after which to check if a transaction is aborted.

flag.name: aggressive_compaction_for_read_amp
flag.meaning: Determines if we should compact aggressively to reduce read amplification based on number of files alone, without regards to relative sizes of the SSTable files.

flag.name: allow_insecure_connections
flag.meaning: Whether we should allow insecure connections.

flag.name: allow_preempting_compactions
flag.meaning: Whether a compaction may be preempted in favor of another compaction with higher priority

flag.name: apply_intents_task_injected_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject such delay before applying intents for large transactions. Could be used to throttle the apply speed.

flag.name: async_replication_idle_delay_ms
flag.meaning: How long to delay between polling when we expect no data at the destination.

flag.name: async_replication_max_idle_wait
flag.meaning: Maximum number of consecutive empty GetChanges until the poller backs off to the idle interval, rather than immediately retrying.

flag.name: async_replication_polling_delay_ms
flag.meaning: How long to delay in ms between applying and polling.

flag.name: auto_flags_load_from_master_backoff_increment_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds added to the delay between reties of fetching AutoFlags config from master leader. This delay is applied after the RPC reties have been exhausted.

flag.name: auto_flags_load_from_master_max_backoff_sec
flag.meaning: Maximum number of seconds to delay between reties of fetching AutoFlags config from master leader. This delay is applied after the RPC reties have been exhausted.

flag.name: auto_promote_nonlocal_transactions_to_global
flag.meaning: Automatically promote transactions touching data outside of region to global.

flag.name: automatic_compaction_extra_priority
flag.meaning: Assigns automatic compactions extra priority when automatic tablet splits are enabled. This deprioritizes manual compactions including those induced by the tserver (e.g. post-split compactions). Suggested value between 0 and 50.

flag.name: avoid_abort_after_sealing_ms
flag.meaning: If transaction was only sealed, we will try to abort it not earlier than this period in milliseconds.

flag.name: backfill_index_client_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for BackfillIndex RPCs from client to master.

flag.name: backfill_index_rate_rows_per_sec
flag.meaning: Rate of at which the indexed table's entries are populated into the index table during index backfill. This is a per-tablet flag, i.e. a tserver responsible for multiple tablets could be processing more than this.

flag.name: backfill_index_timeout_grace_margin_ms
flag.meaning: The time we give the backfill process to wrap up the current set of writes and return successfully the RPC with the information about how far we have processed the rows.

flag.name: backfill_index_write_batch_size
flag.meaning: The batch size for backfilling the index.

flag.name: backpressure_recovery_period_ms
flag.meaning: Once we hit a backpressure/service-overflow we will consider dropping stale requests for this duration (in ms)

flag.name: binary_call_parser_reject_on_mem_tracker_hard_limit
flag.meaning: Whether to reject/ignore calls on hitting mem tracker hard limit.

flag.name: block_restart_interval
flag.meaning: Controls the number of keys to look at for computing the diff encoding.

flag.name: bytes_durable_wal_write_mb
flag.meaning: Amount of data in MB after which the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync(). If 0 fsysnc() is not called.

flag.name: bytes_remote_bootstrap_durable_write_mb
flag.meaning: Explicitly call fsync after downloading the specified amount of data in MB during a remote bootstrap session. If 0 fsync() is not called.

flag.name: cache_overflow_single_touch
flag.meaning: Whether to enable overflow of single touch cache into the multi touch cache allocation

flag.name: cache_single_touch_ratio
flag.meaning: Fraction of the cache dedicated to single-touch items

flag.name: callhome_collection_level
flag.meaning: Level of details sent by callhome

flag.name: callhome_enabled
flag.meaning: Enables callhome feature that sends analytics data to yugabyte

flag.name: callhome_interval_secs
flag.meaning: How often to run callhome

flag.name: callhome_tag
flag.meaning: Tag to be inserted in the json sent to FLAGS_callhome_url. This tag is used by itest to specify that the data generated by callhome should be discarded by the receiver.

flag.name: callhome_url
flag.meaning: URL of callhome server

flag.name: cdc_checkpoint_opid_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval up to which CDC consumer's checkpoint is considered for retaining log cache.If we haven't received an updated checkpoint from CDC consumer within the interval specified by cdc_checkpoint_opid_interval, then log cache does not consider that consumer while determining which op IDs to evict.

flag.name: cdc_consumer_handler_thread_pool_size
flag.meaning: Override the max thread pool size for CDCConsumerHandler, which is used by CDCPollers. If set to 0, then the thread pool will use the default size (number of cpus on the system).

flag.name: cdc_consumer_use_proxy_forwarding
flag.meaning: When enabled, read requests from the CDC Consumer that go to the wrong node are forwarded to the correct node by the Producer.

flag.name: cdc_enable_replicate_intents
flag.meaning: Enable replication of intents before they've been committed.

flag.name: cdc_force_remote_tserver
flag.meaning: Avoid local tserver apply optimization for CDC and force remote RPCs.

flag.name: cdc_get_changes_free_rpc_ratio
flag.meaning: When the TServer only has this percentage of RPCs remaining because the rest are GetChanges, reject additional requests to throttle/backoff and prevent deadlocks.

flag.name: cdc_intent_retention_ms
flag.meaning: Interval up to which CDC consumer's checkpoint is considered for retaining intents.If we haven't received an updated checkpoint from CDC consumer within the interval specified by cdc_checkpoint_opid_interval, then CDC does not consider that consumer while determining which op IDs to delete from the intent.

flag.name: cdc_max_apply_batch_num_records
flag.meaning: Max CDC write request batch num records. If set to 0, there is no max num records, which means batches will be limited only by size.

flag.name: cdc_max_apply_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Max CDC write request batch size in kb. If 0, default to consensus_max_batch_size_bytes.

flag.name: cdc_max_stream_intent_records
flag.meaning: Max number of intent records allowed in single cdc batch.

flag.name: cdc_min_replicated_index_considered_stale_secs
flag.meaning: If cdc_min_replicated_index hasn't been replicated in this amount of time, we reset itsvalue to max int64 to avoid retaining any logs

flag.name: cdc_read_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for CDC read rpc calls. Reads normally occur cross-cluster.

flag.name: cdc_read_safe_deadline_ratio
flag.meaning: When the heartbeat deadline has this percentage of time remaining, the master should halt tablet report processing so it can respond in time.

flag.name: cdc_snapshot_batch_size
flag.meaning: Batch size for the snapshot operation in CDC

flag.name: cdc_state_checkpoint_update_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Rate at which CDC state's checkpoint is updated.

flag.name: cdc_transaction_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Don't check for an aborted transaction unless its original write is lagging by this duration.

flag.name: cdc_write_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for CDC write rpc calls. Writes normally occur intra-cluster.

flag.name: cdc_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests for CDC.

flag.name: cert_file_pattern
flag.meaning: Pattern used for certificate file

flag.name: cert_node_filename
flag.meaning: The file name that will be used in the names of the node certificates and keys. These files will be named : 'node.{cert_node_filename}.{key|crt}'. If this flag is not set, then --server_broadcast_addresses will be used if it is set, and if not, --rpc_bind_addresses will be used.

flag.name: certs_dir
flag.meaning: Directory that contains certificate authority, private key and certificates for this server. By default 'certs' subdir in data folder is used.

flag.name: certs_for_cdc_dir
flag.meaning: The parent directory of where all certificates for xCluster producer universes will be stored, for when the producer and consumer clusters use different certificates. Place the certificates for each producer cluster in <certs_for_cdc_dir>/<producer_cluster_id>/*.

flag.name: certs_for_client_dir
flag.meaning: Directory that contains certificate authority, private key and certificates for this server that should be used for client to server communications. When empty, the same dir as for server to server communications is used.

flag.name: cipher_list
flag.meaning: Define the list of available ciphers (TLSv1.2 and below).

flag.name: ciphersuites
flag.meaning: Define the available TLSv1.3 ciphersuites.

flag.name: cleanup_intents_sst_files
flag.meaning: Cleanup intents files that are no more relevant to any running transaction.

flag.name: cleanup_metrics_interval_sec
flag.meaning: The tick interval time for the metrics cleanup background task. If set to 0, it disables the background task.

flag.name: cleanup_split_tablets_interval_sec
flag.meaning: Interval at which tablet manager tries to cleanup split tablets which are no longer needed. Setting this to 0 disables cleanup of split tablets.

flag.name: client_read_write_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for client read and write operations.

flag.name: clock_skew_force_crash_bound_usec
flag.meaning: If the clock skew larger than this amount (microseconds) is observed, we will force a crash regardless of the value of fail_on_out_of_range_clock_skew. This is useful for avoiding really large hybrid clock jumps. Set to 0 to disable the check. Note that this check is only preformed for clock skew greater than max_clock_skew_usec.

flag.name: collect_end_to_end_traces
flag.meaning: If true, collected traces includes information for sub-components potentially running on a different server.

flag.name: colorlogtostderr
flag.meaning: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)

flag.name: compaction_priority_start_bound
flag.meaning: Compaction task of DB that has number of SST files less than specified will have priority 0.

flag.name: compaction_priority_step_size
flag.meaning: Compaction task of DB that has number of SST files greater that compaction_priority_start_bound will get 1 extra priority per every compaction_priority_step_size files.

flag.name: compression_type
flag.meaning: On-disk compression type to use in RocksDB.By default, Snappy is used if supported.

flag.name: consensus_lagging_follower_threshold
flag.meaning: Number of retransmissions at tablet leader to mark a follower as lagging. -1 disables the feature.

flag.name: consensus_log_scoped_watch_delay_append_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: If consensus log append takes longer than this, the kernel watchdog will print out a stack trace.

flag.name: consensus_log_scoped_watch_delay_callback_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: If calling consensus log callback(s) take longer than this, the kernel watchdog will print out a stack trace.

flag.name: consensus_max_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum per-tablet RPC batch size when updating peers.

flag.name: consensus_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for all consensus internal RPC communications.

flag.name: consistent_restore
flag.meaning: Whether to enable consistent restoration of snapshots

flag.name: cql_allow_static_column_index
flag.meaning: Raise unsupported error when creating an index on static columns

flag.name: cql_always_return_metadata_in_execute_response
flag.meaning: Force returning the table metadata in the EXECUTE request response

flag.name: cql_check_table_schema_in_paging_state
flag.meaning: Return error for prepared SELECT statement execution if the table was altered during the prepared statement execution.

flag.name: cql_nodelist_refresh_interval_secs
flag.meaning: Interval after which a node list refresh event should be sent to all CQL clients.

flag.name: cql_prepare_child_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout if preparing for child transaction takes longerthan the prescribed threshold.

flag.name: cql_processors_limit
flag.meaning: Limit number of CQL processors. Positive means absolute limit. Negative means number of processors per 1GB of root mem tracker memory limit. 0 - unlimited.

flag.name: cql_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the CQL proxy to

flag.name: cql_proxy_broadcast_rpc_address
flag.meaning: RPC address to broadcast to other nodes. This is the broadcast_address used in the system.local table

flag.name: cql_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for CQL proxy

flag.name: cql_raise_index_where_clause_error
flag.meaning: Raise unsupported error if where clause is specified for create index

flag.name: cql_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: cql_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: CQL RPC memory limit

flag.name: cql_server_always_send_events
flag.meaning: All CQL connections automatically subscribed for all CQL events.

flag.name: cql_service_max_prepared_statement_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum amount of memory the CQL proxy should use to maintain prepared statements. 0 or negative means unlimited.

flag.name: cql_service_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for CQL service

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_empty_responses
flag.meaning: Whether to cache empty responses from the master.

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_stale_msecs
flag.meaning: Maximum permitted staleness for the system query cache. <= 0 permits infinite staleness.

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_tables
flag.meaning: Tables to cache connection data for. Entries are semicolon-delimited, in the format <keyspace>.<table>.

flag.name: cql_table_is_transactional_by_default
flag.meaning: When the 'transactions' property is not specified at CREATE TABLE time for a YCQL table, this flag determines the default setting for whether the table is transactional or not.

flag.name: cql_update_system_query_cache_msecs
flag.meaning: How often the system query cache should be updated. <= 0 disables caching.

flag.name: cql_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests originating in the cql layer

flag.name: db_block_cache_num_shard_bits
flag.meaning: Number of bits to use for sharding the block cache (defaults to 4 bits)

flag.name: db_block_cache_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB block cache (in bytes). This defaults to -1 for system auto-generated default, which would use FLAGS_db_block_cache_size_percentage to select a percentage of the total memory as the default size for the shared block cache. Value of -2 disables block cache.

flag.name: db_block_cache_size_percentage
flag.meaning: Default percentage of total available memory to use as block cache size, if not asking for a raw number, through FLAGS_db_block_cache_size_bytes. Defaults to -3 (use default percentage as defined by master or tserver).

flag.name: db_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB data block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_filter_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB filter block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_index_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB index block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_min_keys_per_index_block
flag.meaning: Minimum number of keys per index block.

flag.name: db_write_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB write buffer (in bytes). -1 to use default.

flag.name: delete_intents_sst_files
flag.meaning: Delete whole intents .SST files when possible.

flag.name: detect_duplicates_for_retryable_requests
flag.meaning: Enable tracking of write requests that prevents the same write from being applied twice.

flag.name: disable_alter_vs_write_mutual_exclusion
flag.meaning: A safety switch to disable the changes from D8710 which makes a schema operation take an exclusive lock making all write operations wait for it.

flag.name: disable_auto_flags_management
flag.meaning: Disables AutoFlags management. A safety switch to turn off automatic promotion of AutoFlags. More information about AutoFlags can be found in https://github.com/yugabyte/yugabyte-db/blob/master/architecture/design/auto_flags.md. Use at your own risk!

flag.name: disable_clock_sync_error
flag.meaning: Whether or not we should keep running if we detect a clock synchronization issue.

flag.name: disable_hybrid_scan
flag.meaning: If true, hybrid scan will be disabled

flag.name: display_bind_params_in_cql_details
flag.meaning: Whether to show bind params for CQL calls details in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: dns_cache_expiration_ms
flag.meaning: Time to store DNS resolution results in cache.

flag.name: drop_log_memory
flag.meaning: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.

flag.name: dump_certificate_entries
flag.meaning: Whether we should dump certificate entries.

flag.name: dump_dbimpl_info
flag.meaning: Dump RocksDB info during constructor.

flag.name: dump_flags_xml
flag.meaning: Dump a XLM document describing all of gFlags used in this binary. Differs from helpxml by displaying the current runtime value as the default instead of the hard coded values from the flag definitions.

flag.name: dump_lock_keys
flag.meaning: Whether to add keys to error message when lock batch timed out

flag.name: dump_transactions
flag.meaning: Dump transactions data in debug binary format

flag.name: durable_wal_write
flag.meaning: Whether the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync() after each write.

flag.name: emulate_redis_responses
flag.meaning: If emulate_redis_responses is false, we hope to get slightly better performance by just returning OK for commands that might require us to read additional records viz. SADD, HSET, and HDEL. If emulate_redis_responses is true, we read the required records to compute the response as specified by the official Redis API documentation. https://redis.io/commands

flag.name: enable_automatic_tablet_splitting
flag.meaning: If false, disables automatic tablet splitting driven from the yb-master side.

flag.name: enable_block_based_table_cache_gc
flag.meaning: Set to true to enable block based table garbage collector.

flag.name: enable_cdc_client_tablet_caching
flag.meaning: Enable caching the tablets found by client.

flag.name: enable_cdc_state_table_caching
flag.meaning: Enable caching the cdc_state table schema.

flag.name: enable_collect_cdc_metrics
flag.meaning: Enable collecting cdc metrics.

flag.name: enable_consensus_exponential_backoff
flag.meaning: Whether exponential backoff based on number of retransmissions at tablet leader for number of entries to replicate to lagging follower is enabled.

flag.name: enable_data_block_fsync
flag.meaning: Whether to enable fsync() of data blocks, metadata, and their parent directories. Disabling this flag may cause data loss in the event of a system crash.

flag.name: enable_deadlock_detection
flag.meaning: If true, enables distributed deadlock detection.

flag.name: enable_direct_local_tablet_server_call
flag.meaning: Enable direct call to local tablet server

flag.name: enable_history_cutoff_propagation
flag.meaning: Should we use history cutoff propagation (true) or calculate it locally (false).

flag.name: enable_leader_failure_detection
flag.meaning: Whether to enable failure detection of tablet leaders. If enabled, attempts will be made to elect a follower as a new leader when the leader is detected to have failed.

flag.name: enable_lease_revocation
flag.meaning: Enables lease revocation mechanism

flag.name: enable_log_cache_gc
flag.meaning: Set to true to enable log cache garbage collector.

flag.name: enable_log_retention_by_op_idx
flag.meaning: If true, logs will be retained based on an op id passed by the cdc service

flag.name: enable_maintenance_manager
flag.meaning: Enable the maintenance manager, runs compaction and tablet cleaning tasks.

flag.name: enable_multi_raft_heartbeat_batcher
flag.meaning: If true, enables multi-Raft batching of raft heartbeats.

flag.name: enable_ondisk_compression
flag.meaning: Determines whether SSTable compression is enabled or not.

flag.name: enable_process_lifetime_heap_profiling
flag.meaning: Enables heap profiling for the lifetime of the process. Profile output will be stored in the directory specified by -heap_profile_path. Enabling this option will disable the on-demand/remote server profile handlers.

flag.name: enable_redis_auth
flag.meaning: Enable AUTH for the Redis service

flag.name: enable_restart_transaction_status_tablets_first
flag.meaning: Set to true to prioritize bootstrapping transaction status tablets first.

flag.name: enable_rpc_keepalive
flag.meaning: Whether to enable RPC keepalive mechanism

flag.name: enable_single_record_update
flag.meaning: Enable packing updates corresponding to a row in single CDC record

flag.name: enable_stream_compression
flag.meaning: Whether it is allowed to use stream compression.

flag.name: enable_tracing
flag.meaning: Flag to enable/disable tracing across the code.

flag.name: enable_transaction_sealing
flag.meaning: Whether transaction sealing is enabled.

flag.name: enable_uncovered_index_select
flag.meaning: Enable executing select statements using uncovered index

flag.name: enable_update_local_peer_min_index
flag.meaning: Enable each local peer to update its own log checkpoint instead of the leader updating all peers.

flag.name: enable_ysql
flag.meaning: Enable YSQL on cluster. Whether to run a PostgreSQL server as a child process of the tablet server.

flag.name: entries_per_index_block
flag.meaning: Number of entries per index block stored in WAL segment file

flag.name: estimated_replicate_msg_size_percentage
flag.meaning: The estimated percentage of replicate message size in a log entry batch.

flag.name: evict_failed_followers
flag.meaning: Whether to evict followers from the Raft config that have fallen too far behind the leader's log to catch up normally or have been unreachable by the leader for longer than follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec

flag.name: expose_metric_histogram_percentiles
flag.meaning: Should we expose the percentiles information for metrics histograms.

flag.name: external_intent_cleanup_secs
flag.meaning: Duration in secs after which to cleanup external intents.

flag.name: fail_on_out_of_range_clock_skew
flag.meaning: In case transactional tables are present, crash the process if clock skew greater than the configured maximum.

flag.name: fatal_details_path_prefix
flag.meaning: A prefix to use for the path of a file to save fatal failure stack trace and other details to.

flag.name: fault_crash_after_rocksdb_flush
flag.meaning: Fraction of time to crash right after a successful RocksDB flush in tests.

flag.name: file_expiration_ignore_value_ttl
flag.meaning: When deciding whether a file has expired, assume that it is safe to ignore value-level TTL and expire based on table TTL only. CAUTION - Shoule only be used for expiration of older SST files without value-level TTL metadata, or for expiring files with incorrect value-level expiration. Misuse can result in the deletion of live data!

flag.name: file_expiration_value_ttl_overrides_table_ttl
flag.meaning: When deciding whether a file has expired, assume that any file with value-level TTL metadata can be expired solely on that metadata. Useful for the expiration of files earlier than the table-level TTL that is set. CAUTION - Should only be used in workloads where the user is certain all data is written with a value-level TTL. Misuse can result in the deletion of live data!

flag.name: flagfile
flag.meaning: load flags from file

flag.name: flush_rocksdb_on_shutdown
flag.meaning: Safely flush RocksDB when instance is destroyed, disabled for crash tests.

flag.name: follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec
flag.meaning: Seconds that a leader is unable to successfully heartbeat to a follower after which the follower is considered to be failed and evicted from the config.

flag.name: force_global_transactions
flag.meaning: Force all transactions to be global transactions

flag.name: force_lookup_cache_refresh_secs
flag.meaning: When non-zero, specifies how often we send a GetTabletLocations request to the master leader to update the tablet replicas cache. This request is only sent if we are processing a ConsistentPrefix read.

flag.name: force_single_shard_waiter_retry_ms
flag.meaning: The amount of time to wait before sending the client of a single shard transaction a retryable error. Such clients are periodically sent a retryable error to ensure we don't maintain waiters in the wait queue for unresponsive or disconnected clients. This is not required for multi-tablet transactions which have a transaction ID and are rolled back if the transaction coordinator does not receive a heartbeat, since for these we will eventually discover that the transaction has been rolled back and remove the waiter. If set to zero, this will default to 30s.

flag.name: forward_redis_requests
flag.meaning: If false, the redis op will not be served if it's not a local request. The op response will be set to the redis error '-MOVED partition_key 0.0.0.0:0'. This works with jedis which only looks at the MOVED part of the reply and ignores the rest. For now, if this flag is true, we will only attempt to read from leaders, so redis_allow_reads_from_followers will be ignored.

flag.name: fromenv
flag.meaning: set flags from the environment [use 'export FLAGS_flag1=value']

flag.name: fs_data_dirs
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of data directories. This argument must be specified.

flag.name: fs_wal_dirs
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of directories for write-ahead logs. This is an optional argument. If this is not specified, fs_data_dirs is used for write-ahead logs also and that's a reasonable default for most use cases.

flag.name: generic_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads to run for the generic service

flag.name: generic_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC Queue length for the generic service

flag.name: get_changes_honor_deadline
flag.meaning: Toggle whether to honor the deadline passed to log reader

flag.name: global_log_cache_size_limit_mb
flag.meaning: Server-wide version of 'log_cache_size_limit_mb'. The total memory used for caching log entries across all tablets is kept under this threshold.

flag.name: global_log_cache_size_limit_percentage
flag.meaning: The maximum percentage of root process memory that can be used for caching log entries across all tablets. Default is 5.

flag.name: global_memstore_size_mb_max
flag.meaning: Global memstore size is determined as a percentage of the available memory. However, this flag limits it in absolute size. Value of 0 means no limit on the value obtained by the percentage. Default is 2048.

flag.name: global_memstore_size_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of total available memory to use for the global memstore. Default is 10. See also memstore_size_mb and global_memstore_size_mb_max.

flag.name: heap_profile_path
flag.meaning: Output path to store heap profiles. If not set profiles are stored in /tmp/<process-name>.<pid>.<n>.heap.

flag.name: heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval at which the TS heartbeats to the master.

flag.name: heartbeat_max_failures_before_backoff
flag.meaning: Maximum number of consecutive heartbeat failures until the Tablet Server backs off to the normal heartbeat interval, rather than retrying.

flag.name: heartbeat_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for the TS->Master heartbeat RPCs.

flag.name: help
flag.meaning: show help on all flags [tip: all flags can have two dashes]

flag.name: help_auto_flag_json
flag.meaning: Dump a JSON document describing all of the AutoFlags available in this binary.

flag.name: helpmatch
flag.meaning: show help on modules whose name contains the specified substr

flag.name: helpon
flag.meaning: show help on the modules named by this flag value

flag.name: helppackage
flag.meaning: show help on all modules in the main package

flag.name: helpshort
flag.meaning: show help on only the main module for this program

flag.name: helpxml
flag.meaning: produce an xml version of help

flag.name: history_cutoff_propagation_interval_ms
flag.meaning: History cutoff propagation interval in milliseconds.

flag.name: ht_lease_duration_ms
flag.meaning: Hybrid time leader lease duration. A leader keeps establishing a new lease or extending the existing one with every UpdateConsensus. A new server is not allowed to add entries to RAFT log until a lease of the old leader is expired. 0 to disable.

flag.name: inbound_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Inbound RPC memory limit

flag.name: index_backfill_additional_delay_before_backfilling_ms
flag.meaning: Operations that are received by the tserver, and have decided how the indexes need to be updated (based on the IndexPermission), will not be added to the list of current transactions until they are replicated/applied. This delay allows for the GetSafeTime method to wait for such operations to be replicated/applied. Ideally, this value should be set to be something larger than the raft-heartbeat-interval but can be as high as the client_rpc_timeout if we want to be more conservative.

flag.name: index_backfill_upperbound_for_user_enforced_txn_duration_ms
flag.meaning: For Non-Txn tables, it is impossible to know at the tservers whether or not an 'old transaction' is still active. To avoid having such old transactions, we assume a bound on the duration of such transactions (during the backfill process) and wait it out. This flag denotes a conservative upper bound on the duration of such user enforced transactions.

flag.name: index_backfill_wait_for_old_txns_ms
flag.meaning: Index backfill needs to wait for transactions that started before the WRITE_AND_DELETE phase to commit or abort before choosing a time for backfilling the index. This is the max time that the GetSafeTime call will wait for, before it resorts to attempt aborting old transactions. This is necessary to guard against the pathological active transaction that never commits from blocking the index backfill forever.

flag.name: index_block_restart_interval
flag.meaning: Controls the number of data blocks to be indexed inside an index block.

flag.name: initial_log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum segment size we want for a new WAL segment, in bytes. This value keeps doubling (for each subsequent WAL segment) till it gets to the maximum configured segment size (log_segment_size_bytes or log_segment_size_mb).

flag.name: initial_seqno
flag.meaning: Initial seqno for new RocksDB instances.

flag.name: instance_uuid_override
flag.meaning: When creating local instance metadata (for master or tserver) in an empty data directory, use this UUID instead of randomly-generated one. Can be used to replace a node that had its disk wiped in some scenarios.

flag.name: intents_compaction_filter_max_errors_to_log
flag.meaning: Maximum number of errors to log for life cycle of the intents compcation filter.

flag.name: intents_flush_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Max time to wait for regular db to flush during flush of intents. After this time flush of regular db will be forced.

flag.name: interval_durable_wal_write_ms
flag.meaning: Interval in ms after which the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync(). If 0 fsysnc() is not called.

flag.name: io_thread_pool_size
flag.meaning: Size of allocated IO Thread Pool.

flag.name: key_file_pattern
flag.meaning: Pattern used for key file

flag.name: leader_failure_exp_backoff_max_delta_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time to sleep in between leader election retries, in addition to the regular timeout. When leader election fails the interval in between retries increases exponentially, up to this value.

flag.name: leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods
flag.meaning: Maximum heartbeat periods that the leader can fail to heartbeat in before we consider the leader to be failed. The total failure timeout in milliseconds is raft_heartbeat_interval_ms times leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods. The value passed to this flag may be fractional.

flag.name: leader_lease_duration_ms
flag.meaning: Leader lease duration. A leader keeps establishing a new lease or extending the existing one with every UpdateConsensus. A new server is not allowed to serve as a leader (i.e. serve up-to-date read requests or acknowledge write requests) until a lease of this duration has definitely expired on the old leader's side.

flag.name: linear_backoff_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds added to delay while using linear backoff strategy.

flag.name: local_ip_for_outbound_sockets
flag.meaning: IP to bind to when making outgoing socket connections. This must be an IP address of the form A.B.C.D, not a hostname. Advanced parameter, subject to change.

flag.name: log_async_preallocate_segments
flag.meaning: Whether the WAL segments preallocation should happen asynchronously

flag.name: log_background_sync_data_fraction
flag.meaning: When log_enable_background_sync is enabled and periodic_sync_unsynced_bytes_ reaches bytes_durable_wal_write_mb_*log_background_sync_data_fraction, the fsync task is pushed to the log-sync queue.

flag.name: log_background_sync_interval_fraction
flag.meaning: When log_enable_background_sync is enabled and time passed since insertion of log entry exceeds interval_durable_wal_write_ms*log_background_sync_interval_fraction the fsync task is pushed to the log-sync queue.

flag.name: log_backtrace_at
flag.meaning: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.

flag.name: log_cache_gc_evict_only_over_allocated
flag.meaning: If set to true, log cache garbage collection would evict only memory that was allocated over limit for log cache. Otherwise it will try to evict requested number of bytes.

flag.name: log_cache_size_limit_mb
flag.meaning: The total per-tablet size of consensus entries which may be kept in memory. The log cache attempts to keep all entries which have not yet been replicated to all followers in memory, but if the total size of those entries exceeds this limit within an individual tablet, the oldest will be evicted.

flag.name: log_dir
flag.meaning: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.

flag.name: log_enable_background_sync
flag.meaning: If true, log fsync operations in the aggresively performed in the background.

flag.name: log_filename
flag.meaning: Prefix of log filename - full path is <log_dir>/<log_filename>.[INFO|WARN|ERROR|FATAL]

flag.name: log_inject_append_latency_ms_max
flag.meaning: The maximum latency to inject before the log append operation.

flag.name: log_inject_latency
flag.meaning: If true, injects artificial latency in log sync operations. Advanced option. Use at your own risk -- has a negative effect on performance for obvious reasons!

flag.name: log_inject_latency_ms_mean
flag.meaning: The number of milliseconds of latency to inject, on average. Only takes effect if --log_inject_latency is true

flag.name: log_inject_latency_ms_stddev
flag.meaning: The standard deviation of latency to inject in before log sync operations. Only takes effect if --log_inject_latency is true

flag.name: log_link
flag.meaning: Put additional links to the log files in this directory

flag.name: log_max_seconds_to_retain
flag.meaning: Log files that are older will be deleted even if they contain cdc unreplicated entries. If 0, this flag will be ignored. This flag is ignored if a log segment contains entries that haven't beenflushed to RocksDB.

flag.name: log_min_seconds_to_retain
flag.meaning: The minimum number of seconds for which to keep log segments to keep at all times, regardless of what is required for durability. Logs may be still retained for a longer amount of time if they are necessary for correct restart. This should be set long enough such that a tablet server which has temporarily failed can be restarted within the given time period. If a server is down for longer than this amount of time, it is possible that its tablets will be re-replicated on other machines.

flag.name: log_min_segments_to_retain
flag.meaning: The minimum number of past log segments to keep at all times, regardless of what is required for durability. Must be at least 1.

flag.name: log_preallocate_segments
flag.meaning: Whether the WAL should preallocate the entire segment before writing to it

flag.name: log_prefix
flag.meaning: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line

flag.name: log_prefix_include_pid
flag.meaning: Include PID into the log prefix

flag.name: log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The default segment size for log roll-overs, in bytes. If 0 then log_segment_size_mb is used.

flag.name: log_segment_size_mb
flag.meaning: The default segment size for log roll-overs, in MB

flag.name: log_stop_retaining_min_disk_mb
flag.meaning: Stop retaining logs if the space available for the logs falls below this limit. This flag is ignored if a log segment contains unflushed entries.

flag.name: logbuflevel
flag.meaning: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; ...)

flag.name: logbufsecs
flag.meaning: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds

flag.name: logfile_mode
flag.meaning: Log file mode/permissions.

flag.name: logtostderr
flag.meaning: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles

flag.name: lookup_cache_refresh_secs
flag.meaning: When non-zero, specifies how often we send a GetTabletLocations request to the master leader to update the tablet replicas cache. This request is only sent if we are processing a ConsistentPrefix read and the RPC layer has determined that its view of the replicas is inconsistent with what the master has reported

flag.name: maintenance_manager_num_threads
flag.meaning: Size of the maintenance manager thread pool. Beyond a value of '1', one thread is reserved for emergency flushes. For spinning disks, the number of threads should not be above the number of devices.

flag.name: max_clock_skew_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction read clock skew in usec. This is the maximum allowed time delta between servers of a single cluster.

flag.name: max_clock_sync_error_usec
flag.meaning: Maximum allowed clock synchronization error as reported by NTP before the server will abort.

flag.name: max_concurrent_master_lookups
flag.meaning: Maximum number of concurrent tablet location lookups from YB client to master

flag.name: max_group_replicate_batch_size
flag.meaning: Maximum number of operations to submit to consensus for replication in a batch.

flag.name: max_log_size
flag.meaning: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.

flag.name: max_message_length
flag.meaning: The maximum message length of the cql message.

flag.name: max_nexts_to_avoid_seek
flag.meaning: The number of next calls to try before doing resorting to do a rocksdb seek.

flag.name: max_num_tablets_for_table
flag.meaning: Max number of tablets that can be specified in a CREATE TABLE statement

flag.name: max_rejection_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Maximal delay for rejected write to be retried in milliseconds.

flag.name: max_stale_read_bound_time_ms
flag.meaning: If we are allowed to read from followers, specify the maximum time a follower can be behind by using the last message received from the leader. If set to zero, a read can be served by a follower regardless of when was the last time it received a message from the leader or how far behind this follower is.

flag.name: max_tables_metrics_breakdowns
flag.meaning: The maxmimum number of tables to retrieve metrics for

flag.name: max_time_in_queue_ms
flag.meaning: Fail calls that get stuck in the queue longer than the specified amount of time (in ms)

flag.name: max_transactions_in_status_request
flag.meaning: Request status for at most specified number of transactions at once. 0 disables load time transaction status resolution.

flag.name: max_wait_for_processresponse_before_closing_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of time we will wait in Peer::Close() for Peer::ProcessResponse() to finish before returning proceding to close the Peer and return

flag.name: max_wait_for_safe_time_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for the safe time to advance when trying to scan at the given hybrid_time.

flag.name: mem_tracker_log_stack_trace
flag.meaning: Enable logging of stack traces on memory tracker consume/release operations. Only takes effect if mem_tracker_logging is also enabled.

flag.name: mem_tracker_logging
flag.meaning: Enable logging of memory tracker consume/release operations

flag.name: mem_tracker_tcmalloc_gc_release_bytes
flag.meaning: When the total amount of memory from calls to Release() since the last GC exceeds this flag, a new tcmalloc GC will be triggered. This GC will clear the tcmalloc page heap freelist. A higher value implies less aggressive GC, i.e. higher memory overhead, but more efficient in terms of runtime.

flag.name: mem_tracker_update_consumption_interval_us
flag.meaning: Interval that is used to update memory consumption from external source. For instance from tcmalloc statistics.

flag.name: memory_limit_hard_bytes
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of memory this daemon should use, in bytes. A value of 0 autosizes based on the total system memory. A value of -1 disables all memory limiting.

flag.name: memory_limit_soft_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before memory throttling of writes begins. The greater the excess, the higher the chance of throttling. In general, a lower soft limit leads to smoother write latencies but decreased throughput, and vice versa for a higher soft limit.

flag.name: memory_limit_termination_threshold_pct
flag.meaning: If the RSS (resident set size) of the program reaches this percentage of the root memory tracker limit, the program will exit. RSS is measured using operating system means, not the memory allocator. Set to 0 to disable this behavior.

flag.name: memory_limit_warn_threshold_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before WARNING level messages are periodically logged.

flag.name: memstore_arena_size_kb
flag.meaning: Size of each arena allocation for the memstore

flag.name: memstore_size_mb
flag.meaning: Max size (in mb) of the memstore, before needing to flush.

flag.name: meta_cache_lookup_throttling_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Max delay between calls during lookup throttling.

flag.name: meta_cache_lookup_throttling_step_ms
flag.meaning: Step to increment delay between calls during lookup throttling.

flag.name: metric_node_name
flag.meaning: Value to use as node name for metrics reporting

flag.name: metrics_log_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval (in milliseconds) at which the server will dump its metrics to a local log file. The log files are located in the same directory as specified by the -log_dir flag. If this is not a positive value, then metrics logging will be disabled.

flag.name: metrics_retirement_age_ms
flag.meaning: The minimum number of milliseconds a metric will be kept for after it is no longer active. (Advanced option)

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval at which the metrics are snapshotted.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_table_metrics_whitelist
flag.meaning: Table metrics to record in native metrics storage.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_tserver_metrics_whitelist
flag.meaning: Tserver metrics to record in native metrics storage.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_ttl_ms
flag.meaning: Ttl for snapshotted metrics.

flag.name: min_leader_stepdown_retry_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Minimum amount of time between successive attempts to perform the leader stepdown for the same combination of tablet and intended (target) leader. This is needed to avoid infinite leader stepdown loops when the current leader never has a chance to update the intended leader with its latest records.

flag.name: min_rejection_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Minimal delay for rejected write to be retried in milliseconds.

flag.name: min_sidecar_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Minimal buffer to allocate for sidecar

flag.name: minicluster_daemon_id
flag.meaning: A human-readable 'daemon id', e.g. 'm-1' or 'ts-2', used in tests.

flag.name: minloglevel
flag.meaning: Messages logged at a lower level than this don't actually get logged anywhere

flag.name: multi_raft_batch_size
flag.meaning: Maximum batch size for a multi-Raft consensus payload. Ignored if set to zero.

flag.name: multi_raft_heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: The heartbeat interval for batch Raft replication.

flag.name: net_address_filter
flag.meaning: Order in which to select ip addresses returned by the resolverCan be set to something like "ipv4_all,ipv6_all" to prefer IPv4 over IPv6 addresses.Can be set to something like "ipv4_external,ipv4_all,ipv6_all" to prefer external IPv4 addresses first. Other options include ipv6_external,ipv6_non_link_local

flag.name: never_fsync
flag.meaning: Never fsync() anything to disk. This is used by tests to speed up runtime and improve stability. This is very unsafe to use in production.

flag.name: node_to_node_encryption_required_uid
flag.meaning: Allow only certificates with specified uid. Empty to allow any.

flag.name: node_to_node_encryption_use_client_certificates
flag.meaning: Should client certificates be sent and verified for encrypted node to node communication.

flag.name: non_graph_characters_percentage_to_use_hexadecimal_rendering
flag.meaning: Non graph charaters percentage to use hexadecimal rendering

flag.name: num_concurrent_backfills_allowed
flag.meaning: Maximum number of concurrent backfill jobs that is allowed to run.

flag.name: num_connections_to_server
flag.meaning: Number of underlying connections to each server

flag.name: num_cpus
flag.meaning: Number of CPU cores used in calculations

flag.name: num_raft_ops_to_force_idle_intents_db_to_flush
flag.meaning: When writes to intents RocksDB are stopped and the number of Raft operations after the last write to the intents RocksDB is greater than this value, the intents RocksDB would be requested to flush.

flag.name: num_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: Number of libev reactor threads to start. If -1, the value is automatically set.

flag.name: num_reserved_small_compaction_threads
flag.meaning: Number of reserved small compaction threads. It allows splitting small vs. large compactions.

flag.name: num_tablets_to_open_simultaneously
flag.meaning: Number of threads available to open tablets during startup. If this is set to 0 (the default), then the number of bootstrap threads will be set based on the number of data directories. If the data directories are on some very fast storage device such as SSD or a RAID array, it may make sense to manually tune this.

flag.name: o_direct_block_alignment_bytes
flag.meaning: Alignment (in bytes) for blocks used for O_DIRECT operations.

flag.name: o_direct_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of the block to use when flag durable_wal_write is set.

flag.name: outbound_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Outbound RPC memory limit

flag.name: parallelize_bootstrap_producer
flag.meaning: When this is true, use the version of BootstrapProducer with batched and parallelized rpc calls. This is recommended for large input sizes

flag.name: parallelize_read_ops
flag.meaning: Controls whether multiple (Redis) read ops that are present in a operation should be executed in parallel.

flag.name: password_hash_cache_size
flag.meaning: Number of password hashes to cache. 0 or negative disables caching.

flag.name: pg_client_heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Pg client heartbeat interval in ms.

flag.name: pg_client_session_expiration_ms
flag.meaning: Pg client session expiration time in milliseconds.

flag.name: pg_client_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the Pg Client service.

flag.name: pg_mem_tracker_tcmalloc_gc_release_bytes
flag.meaning: Overriding the gflag mem_tracker_tcmalloc_gc_release_bytes defined in mem_tracker.cc. The overriding value is specifically set for Postgres backends

flag.name: pg_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address for the PostgreSQL proxy to bind to

flag.name: pg_verbose_error_log
flag.meaning: True to enable verbose logging of errors in PostgreSQL server

flag.name: pg_yb_session_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for operations between PostgreSQL server and YugaByte DocDB services

flag.name: pggate_master_addresses
flag.meaning: Addresses of the master servers to which the PostgreSQL proxy server connects.

flag.name: pggate_num_connections_to_server
flag.meaning: Number of underlying connections to each server from a PostgreSQL backend process. This overrides the value of --num_connections_to_server.

flag.name: pggate_rpc_timeout_secs
flag.meaning: Timeout for RPCs from pggate to YB cluster

flag.name: pggate_tserver_shm_fd
flag.meaning: File descriptor of the local tablet server's shared memory.

flag.name: pggate_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests originating in the PostgreSQL proxy server

flag.name: pgsql_consistent_transactional_paging
flag.meaning: Whether to enforce consistency of data returned for second page and beyond for YSQL queries on transactional tables. If true, read restart errors could be returned to prevent inconsistency. If false, no read restart errors are returned but the data may be stale. The latter is preferable for long scans. The data returned for the first page of results is never stale regardless of this flag.

flag.name: pgsql_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the PostgreSQL proxy to

flag.name: pgsql_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for PGSQL

flag.name: pgsql_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: placement_cloud
flag.meaning: The cloud in which this instance is started.

flag.name: placement_region
flag.meaning: The cloud region in which this instance is started.

flag.name: placement_uuid
flag.meaning: The uuid of the tservers cluster/placement.

flag.name: placement_zone
flag.meaning: The cloud availability zone in which this instance is started.

flag.name: post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_max_queue_size
flag.meaning: The maximum number of tasks that can be held in the pool for post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_. This pool is used to run compactions on tablets after they have been split and still contain irrelevant data from the tablet they were sourced from.

flag.name: post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_max_threads
flag.meaning: The maximum number of threads allowed for post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_. This pool is used to run compactions on tablets after they have been split and still contain irrelevant data from the tablet they were sourced from.

flag.name: postmaster_cgroup
flag.meaning: cgroup to add postmaster process to

flag.name: print_nesting_levels
flag.meaning: controls the depth of the child traces to be printed.

flag.name: print_trace_every
flag.meaning: Controls the rate at which traces are printed. Setting this to 0 disables printing the collected traces.

flag.name: prioritize_tasks_by_disk
flag.meaning: Consider disk load when considering compaction and flush priorities.

flag.name: priority_thread_pool_size
flag.meaning: Max running workers in compaction thread pool. If -1 and max_background_compactions is specified - use max_background_compactions. If -1 and max_background_compactions is not specified - use sqrt(num_cpus).

flag.name: propagate_safe_time
flag.meaning: Propagate safe time to read from leader to followers

flag.name: protege_synchronization_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout to synchronize protege before performing step down. 0 to disable synchronization.

flag.name: proxy_resolve_cache_ms
flag.meaning: Time in milliseconds to cache resolution result in Proxy

flag.name: raft_heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: The heartbeat interval for Raft replication. The leader produces heartbeats to followers at this interval. The followers expect a heartbeat at this interval and consider a leader to have failed if it misses several in a row.

flag.name: rate_limiter_min_rate
flag.meaning: Minimum transmission rate in bytes/sec

flag.name: rate_limiter_min_size
flag.meaning: Minimum size for each transmission request

flag.name: read_buffer_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Overall limit for read buffers. Positive value - limit in bytes. Negative value - percent of root process memory. Zero - unlimited.

flag.name: read_pool_max_queue_size
flag.meaning: The maximum number of tasks that can be held in the queue for read_pool_. This pool is used to run multiple read operations, that are part of the same tablet rpc, in parallel.

flag.name: read_pool_max_threads
flag.meaning: The maximum number of threads allowed for read_pool_. This pool is used to run multiple read operations, that are part of the same tablet rpc, in parallel.

flag.name: redis_allow_reads_from_followers
flag.meaning: If true, the read will be served from the closest replica in the same AZ, which can be a follower.

flag.name: redis_callbacks_threadpool_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size for the threadpool which handles callbacks from the ybclient layer

flag.name: redis_connection_soft_limit_grace_period_sec
flag.meaning: The duration for which the outbound data needs to exceeed the softlimit before the connection gets closed down.

flag.name: redis_keys_threshold
flag.meaning: Maximum number of keys allowed to be in the db before the KEYS operation errors out

flag.name: redis_max_batch
flag.meaning: Max number of redis commands that forms batch

flag.name: redis_max_command_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of the command in redis

flag.name: redis_max_concurrent_commands
flag.meaning: Max number of redis commands received from single connection, that could be processed concurrently

flag.name: redis_max_queued_bytes
flag.meaning: Max number of bytes in queued redis commands.

flag.name: redis_max_read_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Max read buffer size for Redis connections.

flag.name: redis_max_value_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of the value in redis

flag.name: redis_password_caching_duration_ms
flag.meaning: The duration for which we will cache the redis passwords. 0 to disable.

flag.name: redis_passwords_separator
flag.meaning: The character used to separate multiple passwords.

flag.name: redis_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the redis proxy to

flag.name: redis_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for redis proxy

flag.name: redis_rpc_block_size
flag.meaning: Redis RPC block size

flag.name: redis_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: redis_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Redis RPC memory limit

flag.name: redis_safe_batch
flag.meaning: Use safe batching with Redis service

flag.name: redis_service_yb_client_timeout_millis
flag.meaning: Timeout in milliseconds for RPC calls from Redis service to master/tserver

flag.name: redis_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for redis service

flag.name: ref_counted_debug_type_name_regex
flag.meaning: Regex for type names for debugging RefCounted / scoped_refptr based classes. An empty string disables RefCounted debug logging.

flag.name: regular_tablets_data_block_key_value_encoding
flag.meaning: Key-value encoding to use for regular data blocks in RocksDB. Possible options: shared_prefix, three_shared_parts

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_change_role_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for change role operation during remote bootstrap.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_from_leader_only
flag.meaning: Whether to instruct the peer to attempt bootstrap from the closest peer instead of the leader. The leader too could be the closest peer depending on the new peer's geographic placement. Setting the flag to false will enable remote bootstrap from the closest peer.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_max_chunk_size
flag.meaning: Maximum chunk size to be transferred at a time during remote bootstrap.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec
flag.meaning: Maximum transmission rate during a remote bootstrap. This is across all the remote bootstrap sessions for which this process is acting as a sender or receiver. So the total limit will be 2 * remote_bootstrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec because a tserver or master can act both as a sender and receiver at the same time.

flag.name: replication_failure_delay_exponent
flag.meaning: Max number of failures (N) to use when calculating exponential backoff (2^N-1).

flag.name: require_durable_wal_write
flag.meaning: Whether durable WAL write is required.In case you cannot write using O_DIRECT in WAL and data directories and this flag is set truethe system will deliberately crash with the appropriate error. If this flag is set false, the system will soft downgrade the durable_wal_write flag.

flag.name: reset_master_leader_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout to reset master leader in milliseconds.

flag.name: retry_failed_replica_ms
flag.meaning: Time in milliseconds to wait for before retrying a failed replica

flag.name: retryable_request_range_time_limit_secs
flag.meaning: Max delta in time for single op id range.

flag.name: retryable_request_timeout_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to keep write request in index, to prevent duplicate writes.

flag.name: rlimit_as
flag.meaning: Memory size limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_cpu
flag.meaning: CPU time limit: seconds.

flag.name: rlimit_data
flag.meaning: Data file size limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_fsize
flag.meaning: File size limit: blocks.

flag.name: rlimit_memlock
flag.meaning: Locked memory limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_nofile
flag.meaning: Open files limit.

flag.name: rlimit_nproc
flag.meaning: User process limit.

flag.name: rlimit_stack
flag.meaning: Stack size limit: bytes.

flag.name: rocksdb_base_background_compactions
flag.meaning: Number threads to do background compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_compact_flush_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec
flag.meaning: Use to control write rate of flush and compaction.

flag.name: rocksdb_compact_flush_rate_limit_sharing_mode
flag.meaning: Allows to control rate limit sharing/calculation across RocksDB instances tserver - rate limit is shared across all RocksDB instances at tabset server level none - rate limit is calculated independently for every RocksDB instance

flag.name: rocksdb_compaction_measure_io_stats
flag.meaning: Measure stats for rocksdb compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_compaction_size_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Threshold beyond which compaction is considered large.

flag.name: rocksdb_disable_compactions
flag.meaning: Disable rocksdb compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_file_starting_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Starting buffer size for writable files, grows by 2x every new allocation.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_file_num_compaction_trigger
flag.meaning: Number of files to trigger level-0 compaction. -1 if compaction should not be triggered by number of files at all.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_slowdown_writes_trigger
flag.meaning: The number of files above which writes are slowed down.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_stop_writes_trigger
flag.meaning: The number of files above which compactions are stopped.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_background_compactions
flag.meaning: Increased number of threads to do background compactions (used when compactions need to catch up.) Unless rocksdb_disable_compactions=true, this cannot be set to zero.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_background_flushes
flag.meaning: Number threads to do background flushes.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_file_size_for_compaction
flag.meaning: Maximal allowed file size to participate in RocksDB compaction. 0 - unlimited.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_write_buffer_number
flag.meaning: Maximum number of write buffers that are built up in memory.

flag.name: rocksdb_nothing_in_memtable_to_flush_sleep_ms
flag.meaning: Used for a temporary workaround for http://bit.ly/ybissue437. How long to wait (ms) in case we could not flush any memtables, usually due to filters preventing us from doing so.

flag.name: rocksdb_release_mutex_during_wait_for_memtables_to_flush
flag.meaning: When a flush is scheduled, but there isn't a memtable eligible yet, release the mutex before going to sleep and reacquire it post sleep.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_always_include_size_threshold
flag.meaning: Always include files of smaller or equal size in a compaction.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_min_merge_width
flag.meaning: The minimum number of files in a single compaction run.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_size_ratio
flag.meaning: The percentage upto which files that are larger are include in a compaction.

flag.name: rocksdb_use_logging_iterator
flag.meaning: Wrap newly created RocksDB iterators in a logging wrapper

flag.name: rpc_acceptor_listen_backlog
flag.meaning: Socket backlog parameter used when listening for RPC connections. This defines the maximum length to which the queue of pending TCP connections inbound to the RPC server may grow. If a connection request arrives when the queue is full, the client may receive an error. Higher values may help the server ride over bursts of new inbound connection requests.

flag.name: rpc_bind_addresses
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of addresses to bind to for RPC connections. Currently, ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0) are not allowed.

flag.name: rpc_callback_max_cycles
flag.meaning: The maximum number of cycles for which an RPC callback should be allowed to run without emitting a warning. (Advanced debugging option)

flag.name: rpc_connection_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for RPC connection operations

flag.name: rpc_default_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: rpc_dump_all_traces
flag.meaning: If true, dump all RPC traces at INFO level

flag.name: rpc_max_message_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of a message of any RPC that the server will accept.

flag.name: rpc_queue_limit
flag.meaning: Queue limit for rpc server

flag.name: rpc_read_buffer_size
flag.meaning: RPC connection read buffer size. 0 to auto detect.

flag.name: rpc_server_allow_ephemeral_ports
flag.meaning: Allow binding to ephemeral ports. This can cause problems, so currently only allowed in tests.

flag.name: rpc_slow_query_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: Traces for calls that take longer than this threshold (in ms) are logged

flag.name: rpc_throttle_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Throttle inbound RPC calls larger than specified size on hitting mem tracker soft limit. Throttling is disabled if negative value is specified.

flag.name: rpc_workers_limit
flag.meaning: Workers limit for rpc server

flag.name: rpcs_shutdown_extra_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Extra allowed time for a single RPC command to complete after its deadline.

flag.name: rpcs_shutdown_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for a batch of multiple RPCs invoked in parallel to shutdown.

flag.name: rpcz_max_cql_batch_dump_count
flag.meaning: The maximum number of CQL batch elements in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: rpcz_max_cql_query_dump_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of the CQL query string in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: rpcz_max_redis_query_dump_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of the Redis query string in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: sampled_trace_1_in_n
flag.meaning: Flag to enable/disable sampled tracing. 0 disables.

flag.name: scanner_batch_size_rows
flag.meaning: The number of rows to batch for servicing scan requests.

flag.name: scanner_default_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The default size for batches of scan results

flag.name: scanner_max_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum batch size that a client may request for scan results.

flag.name: send_wait_for_report_interval_ms
flag.meaning: The tick interval time to trigger updating all transaction coordinators with wait-for relationships.

flag.name: server_broadcast_addresses
flag.meaning: Broadcast addresses for this server.

flag.name: server_tcmalloc_max_total_thread_cache_bytes
flag.meaning: Total number of bytes to use for the thread cache for tcmalloc across all threads in the tserver/master.

flag.name: skip_flushed_entries
flag.meaning: Only replay WAL entries that are not flushed to RocksDB or within the retryable request timeout.

flag.name: skip_tablet_data_verification
flag.meaning: Skip checking tablet data for corruption.

flag.name: skip_wal_rewrite
flag.meaning: Skip rewriting WAL files during bootstrap.

flag.name: small_compaction_extra_priority
flag.meaning: Small compaction will get small_compaction_extra_priority extra priority.

flag.name: socket_receive_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Socket receive buffer size, 0 to use default

flag.name: ssl_protocols
flag.meaning: List of allowed SSL protocols (ssl2, ssl3, tls10, tls11, tls12). Empty to allow TLS only.

flag.name: sst_files_hard_limit
flag.meaning: When majority SST files number is greater that this limit, we will reject all write requests.

flag.name: sst_files_soft_limit
flag.meaning: When majority SST files number is greater that this limit, we will start rejecting part of write requests. The higher the number of SST files, the higher probability of rejection.

flag.name: start_cql_proxy
flag.meaning: Starts a CQL proxy along with the tablet server

flag.name: start_pgsql_proxy
flag.meaning: Whether to run a PostgreSQL server as a child process of the tablet server

flag.name: start_redis_proxy
flag.meaning: Starts a redis proxy along with the tablet server

flag.name: stderrthreshold
flag.meaning: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.

flag.name: stepdown_disable_graceful_transition
flag.meaning: During a leader stepdown, disable graceful leadership transfer to an up to date peer

flag.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk
flag.meaning: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.

flag.name: stop_on_parent_termination
flag.meaning: When specified, this process will terminate when parent process terminates.Linux-only.

flag.name: stream_compression_algo
flag.meaning: Algorithm used for stream compression. 0 - no compression, 1 - gzip, 2 - snappy, 3 - lz4.

flag.name: stream_truncate_record
flag.meaning: Enable streaming of TRUNCATE record

flag.name: suicide_on_eio
flag.meaning: Kill the process if an I/O operation results in EIO

flag.name: svc_queue_length_default
flag.meaning: Default RPC queue length for a service

flag.name: symbolize_stacktrace
flag.meaning: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone

flag.name: tablet_bloom_block_size
flag.meaning: Block size of the bloom filters used for tablet keys.

flag.name: tablet_bloom_target_fp_rate
flag.meaning: Target false-positive rate (between 0 and 1) to size tablet key bloom filters. A lower false positive rate may reduce the number of disk seeks required in heavy insert workloads, at the expense of more space and RAM required for bloom filters.

flag.name: tablet_do_compaction_cleanup_for_intents
flag.meaning: Whether to clean up intents for aborted transactions in compaction.

flag.name: tablet_do_dup_key_checks
flag.meaning: Whether to check primary keys for duplicate on insertion. Use at your own risk!

flag.name: tablet_enable_ttl_file_filter
flag.meaning: Enables compaction to directly delete files that have expired based on TTL, rather than removing them via the normal compaction process.

flag.name: tablet_operation_memory_limit_mb
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of memory that may be consumed by all in-flight operations belonging to a particular tablet. When this limit is reached, new operations will be rejected and clients will be forced to retry them. If -1, operation memory tracking is disabled.

flag.name: tablet_rocksdb_ops_quiet_down_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Max amount of time we can wait for read/write operations on RocksDB to finish so that we can perform exclusive-ownership operations on RocksDB, such as removing all data in the tablet by replacing the RocksDB instance with an empty one.

flag.name: tablet_server_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS service. If -1, it is auto configured.

flag.name: tablet_server_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS service.

flag.name: taskstream_queue_max_size
flag.meaning: Maximum number of operations waiting in the taskstream queue.

flag.name: taskstream_queue_max_wait_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time in ms to wait for items in the taskstream queue to arrive.

flag.name: tcmalloc_max_free_bytes_percentage
flag.meaning: Maximum percentage of the RSS that tcmalloc is allowed to use for reserved but unallocated memory.

flag.name: temporary_disable_preelections_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: If some of nodes does not support preelections, then we disable them for this amount of time.

flag.name: TEST_check_broadcast_address
flag.meaning: Break connectivity in test mini cluster to check broadcast address.

flag.name: TEST_transaction_allow_rerequest_status
flag.meaning: Allow rerequest transaction status when TryAgain is received.

flag.name: throttle_cql_calls_on_soft_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Whether to reject CQL calls when soft memory limit is reached.

flag.name: throttle_cql_calls_policy
flag.meaning: Policy for throttling CQL calls. 1 - drop throttled calls. 0 - respond with OVERLOADED error.

flag.name: time_based_wal_gc_clock_delta_usec
flag.meaning: A delta in microseconds to add to the clock value used to determine if a WAL segment is safe to be garbage collected. This is needed for clusters running with a skewed hybrid clock, because the clock used for time-based WAL GC is the wall clock, not hybrid clock.

flag.name: timestamp_history_retention_interval_sec
flag.meaning: The time interval in seconds to retain DocDB history for. Point-in-time reads at a hybrid time further than this in the past might not be allowed after a compaction. Set this to be higher than the expected maximum duration of any single transaction in your application.

flag.name: timestamp_syscatalog_history_retention_interval_sec
flag.meaning: The time interval in seconds to retain syscatalog history for CDC to read specific schema version. Point-in-time reads at a hybrid time further than this in the past might not be allowed after a compaction. Set this to be higher than the expected maximum duration of any single transaction in your application.

flag.name: total_mem_watcher_interval_millis
flag.meaning: Interval in milliseconds between checking the total memory usage of the current process as seen by the operating system, and deciding whether to terminate in case of excessive memory consumption.

flag.name: trace_to_console
flag.meaning: Trace pattern specifying which trace events should be dumped directly to the console

flag.name: tracing_level
flag.meaning: verbosity levels (like --v) up to which tracing is enabled.

flag.name: transaction_abort_check_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval to check whether running transaction was aborted.

flag.name: transaction_abort_check_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used when checking for aborted transactions.

flag.name: transaction_check_interval_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction check interval in usec.

flag.name: transaction_deadlock_detection_interval_usec
flag.meaning: Deadlock detection interval in usec.

flag.name: transaction_disable_heartbeat_in_tests
flag.meaning: Disable heartbeat during test.

flag.name: transaction_heartbeat_usec
flag.meaning: Interval of transaction heartbeat in usec.

flag.name: transaction_manager_queue_limit
flag.meaning: Max number of tasks used by transaction manager

flag.name: transaction_manager_workers_limit
flag.meaning: Max number of workers used by transaction manager

flag.name: transaction_max_missed_heartbeat_periods
flag.meaning: Maximum heartbeat periods that a pending transaction can miss before the transaction coordinator expires the transaction. The total expiration time in microseconds is transaction_heartbeat_usec times transaction_max_missed_heartbeat_periods. The value passed to this flag may be fractional.

flag.name: transaction_min_running_check_delay_ms
flag.meaning: When transaction with minimal start hybrid time is updated at transaction participant, we wait at least this number of milliseconds before checking its status at transaction coordinator. Used for the optimization that deletes provisional records RocksDB SSTable files.

flag.name: transaction_min_running_check_interval_ms
flag.meaning: While transaction with minimal start hybrid time remains the same, we will try to check its status at transaction coordinator at regular intervals this long (ms). Used for the optimization that deletes provisional records RocksDB SSTable files.

flag.name: transaction_pool_cleanup_interval_ms
flag.meaning: How frequently we should cleanup transaction pool

flag.name: transaction_pool_reserve_factor
flag.meaning: During cleanup we will preserve number of transactions in pool that equals to average number or take requests during prepration multiplied by this factor

flag.name: transaction_resend_applying_interval_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction resend applying interval in usec.

flag.name: transaction_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by transaction related RPCs in milliseconds.

flag.name: transaction_status_tablet_log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The segment size for transaction status tablet log roll-overs, in bytes.

flag.name: transactions_cleanup_cache_size
flag.meaning: Transactions cleanup cache size.

flag.name: transactions_poll_check_aborted
flag.meaning: Check aborted transactions during poll.

flag.name: transactions_status_poll_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Transactions poll interval.

flag.name: tryfromenv
flag.meaning: set flags from the environment if present

flag.name: ts_admin_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS admin service

flag.name: ts_admin_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS admin service

flag.name: ts_backup_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS backup service

flag.name: ts_backup_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS backup service

flag.name: ts_consensus_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS consensus service. If -1, it is auto configured.

flag.name: ts_consensus_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS consensus service.

flag.name: ts_remote_bootstrap_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS remote bootstrap service

flag.name: ts_remote_bootstrap_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS remote bootstrap service

flag.name: tserver_enable_metrics_snapshotter
flag.meaning: Should metrics snapshotter be enabled

flag.name: tserver_heartbeat_metrics_add_drive_data
flag.meaning: Add drive data to metrics which tserver sends to master

flag.name: tserver_heartbeat_metrics_add_replication_status
flag.meaning: Add replication status to metrics tserver sends to master

flag.name: tserver_heartbeat_metrics_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval (in milliseconds) at which tserver sends its metrics in a heartbeat to master.

flag.name: tserver_master_addrs
flag.meaning: Comma separated addresses of the masters which the tablet server should connect to. The CQL proxy reads this flag as well to determine the new set of masters

flag.name: tserver_master_replication_factor
flag.meaning: Number of master replicas. By default it is detected based on tserver_master_addrs option, but could be specified explicitly together with passing one or more master service domain name and port through tserver_master_addrs for masters auto-discovery when running on Kubernetes.

flag.name: tserver_metrics_snapshotter_yb_client_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Default timeout for the YBClient embedded into the tablet server that is used by metrics snapshotter.

flag.name: tserver_tcmalloc_max_total_thread_cache_bytes
flag.meaning: Total number of bytes to use for the thread cache for tcmalloc across all threads in the tserver. This is being deprecated and is used to fallback/override the value set on the tserver by server_tcmalloc_max_total_thread_cache_bytes.

flag.name: tserver_yb_client_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Default timeout for the YBClient embedded into the tablet server that is used for distributed transactions.

flag.name: txn_max_apply_batch_records
flag.meaning: Max number of apply records allowed in single RocksDB batch. When a transaction's data in one tablet does not fit into specified number of records, it will be applied using multiple RocksDB write batches.

flag.name: txn_print_trace_every_n
flag.meaning: Controls the rate at which txn traces are printed. Setting this to 0 disables printing the collected traces.

flag.name: txn_slow_op_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: Controls the rate at which txn traces are printed. Setting this to 0 disables printing the collected traces.

flag.name: undefok
flag.meaning: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format

flag.name: update_all_tablets_upon_network_failure
flag.meaning: If this is enabled, then upon receiving a network error, we mark the remote server as being unreachable for all tablets in metacache, instead of the single tablet which issued the rpc.

flag.name: update_metrics_interval_ms
flag.meaning: How often to update xDC cluster metrics.

flag.name: update_min_cdc_indices_interval_secs
flag.meaning: How often to read cdc_state table to get the minimum applied index for each tablet across all streams. This information is used to correctly keep log files that contain unapplied entries. This is also the rate at which a tablet's minimum replicated index across all streams is sent to the other peers in the configuration. If flag enable_log_retention_by_op_idx is disabled, this flag has no effect.

flag.name: update_permissions_cache_msecs
flag.meaning: How often the roles' permissions cache should be updated. 0 means never update it

flag.name: use_cassandra_authentication
flag.meaning: If to require authentication on startup.

flag.name: use_client_to_server_encryption
flag.meaning: Use client to server encryption

flag.name: use_docdb_aware_bloom_filter
flag.meaning: Whether to use the DocDbAwareFilterPolicy for both bloom storage and seeks.

flag.name: use_hashed_redis_password
flag.meaning: Store the hash of the redis passwords instead.

flag.name: use_icu_timezones
flag.meaning: Use the new ICU library for timezones instead of boost
