flag.name: use_libbacktrace
flag.meaning: Whether to use the libbacktrace library for symbolizing stack traces

flag.name: use_monotime_for_traces
flag.meaning: Flag to enable use of MonoTime::Now() instead of CoarseMonoClock::Now(). CoarseMonoClock is much cheaper so it is better to use it. However if we need more accurate sub-millisecond level breakdown, we could use MonoTime.

flag.name: use_multi_level_index
flag.meaning: Whether to use multi-level data index.

flag.name: use_node_hostname_for_local_tserver
flag.meaning: Connect to local t-server by using host name instead of local IP

flag.name: use_node_to_node_encryption
flag.meaning: Use node to node encryption.

flag.name: use_preelection
flag.meaning: Whether to use pre election, before doing actual election.

flag.name: use_priority_thread_pool_for_compactions
flag.meaning: When true priority thread pool will be used for compactions, otherwise Env thread pool with Priority::LOW will be used.

flag.name: use_priority_thread_pool_for_flushes
flag.meaning: When true priority thread pool will be used for flushes, otherwise Env thread pool with Priority::HIGH will be used.

flag.name: use_private_ip
flag.meaning: When to use private IP for connection. cloud - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud. region - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud and region. zone - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud, region and zone.never - would never use private IP if broadcast address is specified.

flag.name: v
flag.meaning: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this. Overridable by --vmodule.

flag.name: verify_client_endpoint
flag.meaning: Whether client endpoint should be verified.

flag.name: verify_encrypted_meta_block_checksums
flag.meaning: Whether to verify checksums for meta blocks of encrypted SSTables.

flag.name: verify_index_rate_rows_per_sec
flag.meaning: Rate of at which the indexed table's entries are read during index consistency checks.This is a per-tablet flag, i.e. a tserver responsible for multiple tablets could be processing more than this.

flag.name: verify_index_read_batch_size
flag.meaning: The batch size for reading the index.

flag.name: verify_server_endpoint
flag.meaning: Whether server endpoint should be verified.

flag.name: verify_tablet_data_interval_sec
flag.meaning: The tick interval time for the tablet data integrity verification background task. This defaults to 0, which means disable the background task.

flag.name: version
flag.meaning: show version and build info and exit

flag.name: version_file_json_path
flag.meaning: Path to directory containing JSON file with version info.

flag.name: vmodule
flag.meaning: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.

flag.name: wait_for_safe_op_id_to_apply_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by WaitForSafeOpIdToApply when it was not specified by caller.

flag.name: wait_hybrid_time_sleep_interval_us
flag.meaning: Sleep interval in microseconds that will be used while waiting for specific hybrid time.

flag.name: wait_queue_poll_interval_ms
flag.meaning: The interval duration between wait queue polls to fetch transaction statuses of active blockers.

flag.name: wait_replication_drain_tserver_max_retry
flag.meaning: Maximum number of retry that a tserver will poll its tablets until the tabletsare all caught-up in the replication, before responding to the caller.

flag.name: wait_replication_drain_tserver_retry_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Time in microseconds that a tserver will sleep between each iteration of polling its tablets until the tablets are all caught-up in the replication.

flag.name: web_log_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum number of bytes to display on the debug webserver's log page

flag.name: webserver_authentication_domain
flag.meaning: Domain used for debug webserver authentication

flag.name: webserver_ca_certificate_file
flag.meaning: The location of the certificate of the certificate authority of the debug webserver's SSL certificate file, in .pem format. If empty, system-wide CA certificates are used.

flag.name: webserver_certificate_file
flag.meaning: The location of the debug webserver's SSL certificate file, in .pem format. If empty, webserver SSL support is not enabled

flag.name: webserver_compression_threshold_kb
flag.meaning: The threshold of response size above which compression is performed.Default value is 4KB

flag.name: webserver_doc_root
flag.meaning: Files under <webserver_doc_root> are accessible via the debug webserver. Defaults to $YB_HOME/www, or if $YB_HOME is not set, disables the document root

flag.name: webserver_enable_doc_root
flag.meaning: If true, webserver may serve static files from the webserver_doc_root

flag.name: webserver_interface
flag.meaning: Interface to start debug webserver on. If blank, webserver binds to first host IPpresent in the list of comma separated rpc_bind_addresses

flag.name: webserver_max_post_length_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum length of a POST request that will be accepted by the embedded web server.

flag.name: webserver_num_worker_threads
flag.meaning: Maximum number of threads to start for handling web server requests

flag.name: webserver_password_file
flag.meaning: (Optional) Location of .htpasswd file containing user names and hashed passwords for debug webserver authentication

flag.name: webserver_port
flag.meaning: Port to bind to for the web server

flag.name: webserver_private_key_file
flag.meaning: The location of the debug webserver's SSL private key file, in .pem format. If empty, the private key is assumed to be located in the same file as the certificate.

flag.name: webserver_private_key_password
flag.meaning: The password for the debug webserver's SSL private key. If empty, no password is used.

flag.name: webserver_redirect_http_to_https
flag.meaning: Redirect HTTP requests to the embedded webserver to HTTPS if HTTPS is enabled.

flag.name: webserver_zlib_compression_level
flag.meaning: The zlib compression level.Lower compression levels result in faster execution, but less compression

flag.name: writable_file_use_fsync
flag.meaning: Use fsync(2) instead of fdatasync(2) for synchronizing dirty data to disk.

flag.name: xcluster_consistent_reads
flag.meaning: Enable database level consistent reads in xCluster replicated databases

flag.name: xcluster_safe_time_update_interval_secs
flag.meaning: The interval at which xcluster safe time is computed. This controls the staleness of the data seen when performing database level xcluster consistent reads. If there is any additional lag in the replication, then it will add to the overall staleness of the data.

flag.name: xcluster_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the xCluster service

flag.name: yb_backend_oom_score_adj
flag.meaning: oom_score_adj of postgres backends in linux environments

flag.name: yb_client_admin_operation_timeout_sec
flag.meaning: The number of seconds after which an admin operation should timeout.

flag.name: yb_client_num_reactors
flag.meaning: Number of reactor threads for the yb client to communicate with different tservers.

flag.name: yb_enable_read_committed_isolation
flag.meaning: Defines how READ COMMITTED (which is our default SQL-layer isolation) andREAD UNCOMMITTED are mapped internally. If false (default), both map to the stricter REPEATABLE READ implementation. If true, both use the new READ COMMITTED implementation instead.

flag.name: yb_num_shards_per_tserver
flag.meaning: The default number of shards per table per tablet server when a table is created. If the value is -1, the system sets the number of shards per tserver to 1 if enable_automatic_tablet_splitting is true, and otherwise automatically determines an appropriate value based on number of CPU cores.

flag.name: yb_pg_terminate_child_backend
flag.meaning: Terminate other active server processes when a backend is killed

flag.name: yb_system_namespace_readonly
flag.meaning: Set system keyspace read-only.

flag.name: yb_test_name
flag.meaning: Specifies test name this daemon is running as part of.

flag.name: ybclient_print_trace_every_n
flag.meaning: Controls the rate at which traces from ybclient are printed. Setting this to 0 disables printing the collected traces.

flag.name: ycql_allow_in_op_with_order_by
flag.meaning: Allow IN to be used with ORDER BY clause

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_categories
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of categories to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_keyspaces
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of keyspaces to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_users
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of users to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_categories
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of categories to be included in the audit log, if none - includes all (non-excluded) categories

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_keyspaces
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of keyspaces to be included in the audit log, if none - includes all (non-excluded) keyspaces

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_users
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of users to be included in the audit log, if none - includes all (non-excluded) users

flag.name: ycql_audit_log_level
flag.meaning: Severity level at which an audit will be logged. Could be INFO, WARNING, or ERROR

flag.name: ycql_cache_login_info
flag.meaning: Use authentication information cached locally.

flag.name: ycql_consistent_transactional_paging
flag.meaning: Whether to enforce consistency of data returned for second page and beyond for YCQL queries on transactional tables. If true, read restart errors could be returned to prevent inconsistency. If false, no read restart errors are returned but the data may be stale. The latter is preferable for long scans. The data returned for the first page of results is never stale regardless of this flag.

flag.name: ycql_disable_index_updating_optimization
flag.meaning: If true all secondary indexes must be updated even if the update does not change the index data.

flag.name: ycql_enable_audit_log
flag.meaning: Enable YCQL audit. Use ycql_audit_* flags for fine-grained configuration

flag.name: ycql_enable_packed_row
flag.meaning: Whether packed row is enabled for YCQL.

flag.name: ycql_enable_tracing_flag
flag.meaning: If enabled, setting TRACING ON in cqlsh will cause the server to enable tracing for the requested RPCs and print them. Use this as a safety flag to disable tracing if an errant application has TRACING enabled by mistake.

flag.name: ycql_ldap_base_dn
flag.meaning: Specifies the base directory to begin the user name search

flag.name: ycql_ldap_bind_dn
flag.meaning: Specifies the username to perform the initial search when doing search + bind authentication

flag.name: ycql_ldap_bind_passwd
flag.meaning: Password for username being used to perform the initial search when doing search + bind authentication

flag.name: ycql_ldap_search_attribute
flag.meaning: Attribute to match against the username in the search when doing search + bind authentication. If no attribute is specified, the uid attribute is used.

flag.name: ycql_ldap_search_filter
flag.meaning: The search filter to use when doing search + bind authentication.

flag.name: ycql_ldap_server
flag.meaning: LDAP server of the form <scheme>://<ip>:<port>

flag.name: ycql_ldap_tls
flag.meaning: Connect to LDAP server using TLS encryption.

flag.name: ycql_ldap_user_prefix
flag.meaning: String used for prepending the user name when forming the DN for binding to the LDAP server

flag.name: ycql_ldap_user_suffix
flag.meaning: String used for appending the user name when forming the DN for binding to the LDAP Server.

flag.name: ycql_ldap_users_to_skip_csv
flag.meaning: Users that are authenticated via the local password check instead of LDAP (if ycql_use_ldap=true). This is a comma separated list

flag.name: ycql_num_tablets
flag.meaning: The number of tablets per YCQL table. Default value is -1. Colocated tables are not affected. If it's value is not set then the value of yb_num_shards_per_tserver is used in conjunction with the number of tservers to determine the tablet count. If the user explicitly specifies a value of the tablet count in the Create Table DDL statement (with tablets = x syntax) then it takes precedence over the value of this flag. Needs to be set at tserver.

flag.name: ycql_packed_row_size_limit
flag.meaning: Packed row size limit for YCQL in bytes. 0 to make this equal to SSTable block size.

flag.name: ycql_require_drop_privs_for_truncate
flag.meaning: Require DROP TABLE permission in order to truncate table

flag.name: ycql_serial_operation_in_transaction_block
flag.meaning: If true, operations within a transaction block must be executed in order, at least semantically speaking.

flag.name: ycql_use_ldap
flag.meaning: Use LDAP for user logins

flag.name: ycql_use_local_transaction_tables
flag.meaning: Whether or not to use local transaction tables when possible for YCQL transactions.

flag.name: yedis_enable_flush
flag.meaning: Enables FLUSHDB and FLUSHALL commands in yedis.

flag.name: yql_allow_compatible_schema_versions
flag.meaning: Allow YCQL requests to be accepted even if they originate from a client who is ahead of the server's schema, but is determined to be compatible with the current version.

flag.name: yql_max_value_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of a value in the Yugabyte Query Layer

flag.name: ysql_backward_prefetch_scale_factor
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED. Feature has been removed.

flag.name: ysql_beta_features
flag.meaning: Whether to enable all ysql beta features

flag.name: ysql_client_read_write_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for YSQL's yb-client read/write operations. Falls back on max(client_read_write_timeout_ms, 600s) if set to -1.

flag.name: ysql_datestyle
flag.meaning: The ysql display format for date and time values

flag.name: ysql_default_transaction_isolation
flag.meaning: The ysql transaction isolation level

flag.name: ysql_disable_portal_run_context
flag.meaning: Whether to use portal ybRunContext.

flag.name: ysql_disable_server_file_access
flag.meaning: If true, disables read, write, and execute of local server files. File access can be re-enabled if set to false.

flag.name: ysql_enable_auth
flag.meaning: True to enforce password authentication for all connections

flag.name: ysql_enable_packed_row
flag.meaning: Whether packed row is enabled for YSQL.

flag.name: ysql_enable_update_batching
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED. Feature has been removed

flag.name: ysql_follower_reads_avoid_waiting_for_safe_time
flag.meaning: Controls whether ysql follower reads that specify a not-yet-safe read time should be rejected. This will force them to go to the leader, which will likely be faster than waiting for safe time to catch up.

flag.name: ysql_forward_rpcs_to_local_tserver
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED. Feature has been removed

flag.name: ysql_hba_conf
flag.meaning: Deprecated, use `ysql_hba_conf_csv` flag instead. Comma separated list of postgres hba rules (in order)

flag.name: ysql_hba_conf_csv
flag.meaning: CSV formatted line represented list of postgres hba rules (in order)

flag.name: ysql_log_failed_docdb_requests
flag.meaning: Log failed docdb requests.

flag.name: ysql_log_min_duration_statement
flag.meaning: Sets the duration of each completed ysql statement to be logged if the statement ran for at least the specified number of milliseconds. Zero prints all queries. -1 turns this feature off.

flag.name: ysql_log_min_messages
flag.meaning: Sets the lowest ysql message level to log

flag.name: ysql_log_statement
flag.meaning: Sets which types of ysql statements should be logged

flag.name: ysql_max_connections
flag.meaning: Overrides the maximum number of concurrent ysql connections. If set to 0, Postgres will dynamically determine a platform-specific value

flag.name: ysql_max_read_restart_attempts
flag.meaning: How many read restarts can we try transparently before giving up

flag.name: ysql_max_write_restart_attempts
flag.meaning: Max number of restart attempts made for writes on transaction conflicts.

flag.name: ysql_non_txn_copy
flag.meaning: Execute COPY inserts non-transactionally.

flag.name: ysql_num_shards_per_tserver
flag.meaning: The default number of shards per YSQL table per tablet server when a table is created. If the value is -1, the system sets the number of shards per tserver to 1 if enable_automatic_tablet_splitting is true, and otherwise automatically determines an appropriate value based on number of CPU cores.

flag.name: ysql_num_tablets
flag.meaning: The number of tablets per YSQL table. Default value is -1. If it's value is not set then the value of ysql_num_shards_per_tserver is used in conjunction with the number of tservers to determine the tablet count. If the user explicitly specifies a value of the tablet count in the Create Table DDL statement (split into x tablets syntax) then it takes precedence over the value of this flag. Needs to be set at tserver.

flag.name: ysql_output_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Size of postgres-level output buffer, in bytes. While fetched data resides within this buffer and hasn't been flushed to client yet, we're free to transparently restart operation in case of restart read error.

flag.name: ysql_packed_row_size_limit
flag.meaning: Packed row size limit for YSQL in bytes. 0 to make this equal to SSTable block size.

flag.name: ysql_pg_conf
flag.meaning: Deprecated, use the `ysql_pg_conf_csv` flag instead. Comma separated list of postgres setting assignments

flag.name: ysql_pg_conf_csv
flag.meaning: CSV formatted line represented list of postgres setting assignments

flag.name: ysql_prefetch_limit
flag.meaning: Maximum number of rows to prefetch

flag.name: ysql_request_limit
flag.meaning: Maximum number of requests to be sent at once

flag.name: ysql_scan_deadline_margin_ms
flag.meaning: Scan deadline is calculated by adding client timeout to the time when the request was received. It defines the moment in time when client has definitely timed out and if the request is yet in processing after the deadline, it can be canceled. Therefore to prevent client timeout, the request handler should return partial result and paging information some time before the deadline. That's what the ysql_scan_deadline_margin_ms is for. It should account for network and processing delays.

flag.name: ysql_scan_timeout_multiplier
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED. Has no affect, use ysql_scan_deadline_margin_ms to control the client timeout

flag.name: ysql_select_parallelism
flag.meaning: Number of read requests to issue in parallel to tablets of a table for SELECT.

flag.name: ysql_sequence_cache_minval
flag.meaning: Set how many sequence numbers to be preallocated in cache.

flag.name: ysql_serializable_isolation_for_ddl_txn
flag.meaning: Whether to use serializable isolation for separate DDL-only transactions. By default, repeatable read isolation is used. This flag should go away once full transactional DDL is implemented.

flag.name: ysql_session_max_batch_size
flag.meaning: Use session variable ysql_session_max_batch_size instead. Maximum batch size for buffered writes between PostgreSQL server and YugaByte DocDB services

flag.name: ysql_sleep_before_retry_on_txn_conflict
flag.meaning: Whether to sleep before retrying the write on transaction conflicts.

flag.name: ysql_suppress_unsupported_error
flag.meaning: Suppress ERROR on use of unsupported SQL statement and use WARNING instead

flag.name: ysql_timezone
flag.meaning: Overrides the default ysql timezone for displaying and interpreting timestamps. If no value is provided, Postgres will determine one based on the environment

flag.name: ysql_transaction_abort_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Max amount of time we can wait for active transactions to abort on a tablet after DDL (eg. DROP TABLE) is executed. This deadline is same as unresponsive_ts_rpc_timeout_ms

flag.name: ysql_wait_until_index_permissions_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED: use backfill_index_client_rpc_timeout_ms instead.

flag.name: ysql_yb_enable_expression_pushdown
flag.meaning: Push supported expressions from ysql down to DocDB for evaluation.

flag.name: ysql_yb_index_state_flags_update_delay
flag.meaning: Delay in milliseconds between stages of online index build. Set high to give online transactions more time to complete.

flag.name: ysql_yb_xcluster_consistency_level
flag.meaning: Controls the consistency level of xCluster replicated databases. Valid values are "database" and "tablet".
